qas.question: Who opened the original "modern" department store in America?
What feature made Wanamakers different from other stores at the time?

answers.text: fixed prices marked on every article

qas.question: How were important documents and money transported throughout the store?
When was electric lighting first installed and used in the store?
In what state was Wanamakers established?
Who opened the last "modern" department store in America?

plausible_answers.text: fixed prices marked on every article

qas.question: What feature made Wanamakers the same as other stores at the time?
How were unimportant documents and money transported throughout the store?
When was electric lighting last installed and used in the store?
In what state wasn't Wanamakers established?

context: In 1877, <a0_0><b5_0>John Wanamaker<b5_0/><a0_0/> opened the United State's first modern department store in a former <a4_0><b9_0>Pennsylvania<b9_0/><a4_0/> Railroad freight terminal in Philadelphia. Wanamakers was the first department store to offer <a1_0><b6_0>fixed prices marked on every article<b6_0/><a1_0/> and also introduced electrical illumination (<a3_0><b8_0>1878<b8_0/><a3_0/>), the telephone (1879), and the use of <a2_0><b7_0>pneumatic tubes<b7_0/><a2_0/> to transport cash and documents (1880) to the department store business. Subsequent department stores founded in Philadelphia included Strawbridge and Clothier, Gimbels, Lit Brothers, and Snellenbergs.
